TopicTitle: System crashes when in map view.

Articles.Content:
The game works fine when playing the game in vessel view ,but in map view the game crashes to black. I never had a problem with this game before until v0.90 update.

GeForce GTX 650 Ti Driver 344.75

Intel Core 15-25000K CPU @ 3.00GHz

32.00 GB RAM

Win 7

Please see the stickied Stock Support thread; we need data to be able to figure out what's going on.

Log files, DxDiag report, and any files generated as a result of the crash.

This is all i can find.

http://www.dropbox.com/s/ogn33q94dlb0g5f/output_log.txt?n=377016323 :output_log.txt

http://www.dropbox.com/s/p8h5mvjkq4mbwzb/DxDiag.txt?n=377016323 dxDiag.txt

also windows give me a recovered from an unexpected shutdown thing ,i am not sure is this important ,but i going to just throw this out there. Just in case.

Problem signature:

Problem Event Name: BlueScreen

OS Version: 6.1.7601.2.1.0.256.48

Locale ID: 1033

Additional information about the problem:

BCCode: 116

BCP1: FFFFFA801F89B4E0

BCP2: FFFFF8800F931828

BCP3: FFFFFFFFC000009A

BCP4: 0000000000000004

OS Version: 6_1_7601

Service Pack: 1_0

Product: 256_1

Files that help describe the problem:

C:\Windows\Minidump\011215-26956-01.dmp

C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Temp\WER-306651-0.sysdata.xml

Okay, well... The only thing I can determine is that what's crashing is not the result of KSP itself crashing -- the log simply cuts off, no mention of any crash in KSP itself.

The only data I can find on the error from the bluescreen crash is that it is either an issue with your video card drivers, or it's a hardware issue. Try updating your video card drivers. If that doesn't work, you might want to try reverting to an earlier version of the drivers.

If none of that works, it looks very much like there's some hardware going bunk, and the apparent candidates there are either the video card itself, or the motherboard (possibly just the PCI-E slot the card is currently occupying).
